00020 // This file deals with general C++ things which aren't specific to Minion.
00021 
00022 #ifndef _MINION_SYSTEM_H
00023 #define _MINION_SYSTEM_H
00024 
00025 // On linux systems, _longjmp and _setjmp are faster versions that ignore
00026 // system signals, which Minion doesn't use.
00027 #ifdef __GNUC__
00028 #define SYSTEM_LONGJMP _longjmp
00029 #define SYSTEM_SETJMP  _setjmp
00030 
00031 #define _NORETURN __attribute__ ((noreturn))
00032 #define _NOINLINE __attribute__((noinline))
00033 #else
00034 #define SYSTEM_LONGJMP longjmp
00035 #define SYSTEM_SETJMP  setjmp
00036 
00037 #define _NORETURN
00038 #define _NOINLINE
00039 #endif
00040 
00041 // Stupid visual C++ needs a little hacking
00042 #ifdef _MSC_VER
00043 // We don't want no stupid safe library warnings
00044 #define _SCL_SECURE_NO_DEPRECATE
00045 #define DEFAULT_CALL __std_call
00046 // Supress 'size_t -> int' warnings.
00047 #pragma warning(disable: 4267)
00048 // I don't even get this warning.
00049 #pragma warning(disable: 4244)
00050 // I'll buy a pint for anyone who can figure how to fix this..
00051 // 'unsigned long' : forcing value to BOOL 'true' or 'false'. Of course I am, that's what I want to test!
00052 #pragma warning(disable: 4800)
00053 // At some point I might fix these "signed/unsigned mismatch" warnings...
00054 #pragma warning(disable: 4018)
00055 // Why can't you realise that abort() means the function doesn't have to return?
00056 #pragma warning(disable: 4716)
00057 // Another annoying warning. I'm not sure why Microsoft want to warn about this, it's perfectly common
00058 #pragma warning(disable: 4355)
00059 #else
00060 #define DEFAULT_CALL
00061 #endif // _MSC_VER
